TopicTitle: Toggle between System and Kerb Mouse Cursor in settings.

Articles.Content:
![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif) Frequently, in a broad spectrum of games, I encounter mouse input lag from 'game stylized' cursors. In all the games that have the option, I have to toggle the 'reduce input lag' option to fix it, and if that is not an option then 'use system cursor' usually is, and again it fixes the input lag. Please consider this simple toggle in the settings. This will appease both sides of the 'system/precision' and 'stylized/immersive' argument. Alternatively, supply the steps to disable/revert the cursor in the config if at all possible. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-11T08:24:40Z" title="05/11/2015 08:24  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 11, 2015</time> by Shaggygoblin**

Input lag? I haven't noticed anything like that. I would agree with a setting to toggle between the custom and system cursor, but I've never noticed the new cursor slowing inputs, nor have I seen anyone else mention it. Unless you're trying to build ridiculously huge crafts that lag your PC down to the Marianas Trench. Then, I'm not surprised that it may create a noticeable reduction in performance. But, if it is causing input lag, I can't believe that it's for more than one frame.

I think, if you are experiencing more input lag than that, your problem is probably a niche problem shared by very few people.

Additionally, your poll is quite biased. It should really just read "System cursor" or "Custom cursor."

But, yes. Most games have an option to turn off custom cursors, and it seems like an easy thing to set up, so I would agree that a "use system cursor" setting would be nice.
